newsitem.title: FRANCE: French fin min sees stable fx markets--paper.
newsitem.headline: French fin min sees stable fx markets--paper.

text.p: French Finance Minister Dominique Strauss-Kahn said in a newspaper interview published on Wednesday that currency markets had stabilised and he saw no new big movements in exchange rates.
"I think the process in currency markets has now stabilised," he said in an interview with the International Herald Tribune.

"The current strength of the dollar against the franc is neither a tragedy nor a good thing. We just have to cope with financial markets. At current levels, I expect the big movements are now at an end," he said.
